model
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      model.Game

public class Game
extends java.util.Observable

A Game object represents an instance of a Yahtzee game. The game object implements the Singleton design pattern, and as such, can only be instantiated one time. This particular design will not work for a multi-game environment, such as a web environment where more than one instance of the game would need to be instantiated, but it does add a layer of security in a single-instance environment. A Game object includes a queue of Players, and a game Status.

Version:
2.0.1 2/6/2012
Author:
Aaron Lamb

public static Game getInstance()

getStatus

public Status getStatus()
Gets the current Status of the Game

Returns:
the current Status of the Game

setStatus

public void setStatus(Status status)
Set the current Status of the Game, notifies observers

Parameters:
status - the Status to set
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if status is null

addPlayer

public java.lang.Boolean addPlayer(Player p)
Adds a new Player to the Game, notifies observers This should not be called when the game status is GAME_IN_PROGRESS, or it will not add the Player and return null. Players cannot be added in the middle of a game.

Parameters:
p - the Player to add to the Game
Returns:
true if the Player is added
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the player is null

getPlayers

public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
Returns (by value) a list of Players. The Players returned are in order of current turn, with the Player at the front of the list the current Player.

Returns:
a list of the Players in the Game, in order of current turn

takeScore

public java.lang.Boolean takeScore(Hands hand,
                                   int score)
Records the passed score for the passed hand for the current Player, and notifies the observers.

Parameters:
hand - the hand to score
score - the score for the hand
Returns:
true if the score can be taken, false if it cannot be taken (i.e. if it has already been taken)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if hand is null

getStrategyPlaying

public java.lang.Boolean getStrategyPlaying()
Returns whether the Strategy is currently playing a turn

Returns:
true if the Strategy is currently playing

notifyPlaying

public void notifyPlaying(java.lang.Boolean flag)
Notify the Game object that the Strategy has either begun playing their turn (true) or finished (false). This must be called by the Strategy (even the HumanStrategy) when the turn has begun and finished. (The HumanStrategy may simply call false initially, signifying that it's done.)

Parameters:
flag -

setStrategyPlaySpeed

public void setStrategyPlaySpeed(int speed)
Sets the strategy play speed for the Strategy object. This will set the play speed to the opposite of 100% of the value - i.e., if you pass 100, the timeout will be 0ms, and the play will be very fast.

Parameters:
speed -

getStrategyPlaySpeed

public int getStrategyPlaySpeed()
Returns the play speed (rather the timeout in milliseconds) for the Strategy

Returns:
the timeout (in ms) for the Strategy

resetScores

public void resetScores()
Resets the scores for the Players for the current game and notifies observers.

resetGame

public void resetGame()
Resets the current game by removing all the Players and resetting the Game Status. Notifies observers.

nextTurn

public void nextTurn()
Takes the turn for the next Player. This MUST be called after recording a score in order to ensure Strategy functionality. Additionally, it must be called to start a game.

isOver

public java.lang.Boolean isOver()
Checks if the Game is over by check to see if all the Player's ScoreCards are full.

Returns:
true if Game is over, false if not

recordScores

public void recordScores()
Records the scores from the current game, incrementing the cumulative score

showWinner

public void showWinner()
Rotates the queue of Players so the winner is at the head of the queue Notifies observers
